item.title: UFO sightings in Italy
item.description:
UFO Sightings in Italy ðŸ”—

This article presents a list of alleged UFO sightings in Italy, spanning from ancient times to the late 20th century. It emphasizes that the content may contain original research and lacks sufficient citations.

100 BC ðŸ”—

This section references reports by Iulius Obsequens, detailing a sighting in Tarquinia of a round object moving across the sky from west to east.

91 BC ðŸ”—

Another report from Iulius Obsequens describes events at Aenariae and Spoletum. At Aenariae, a loud noise and a globe of fire appeared in the sky. In Spoletum, a golden globe of fire fell to earth, increased in size, ascended back into the sky, and obscured the sun.

43 BC ðŸ”—

Iulius Obsequens is cited again, reporting an object resembling a weapon or missile rising from the earth into the sky with a loud noise.

1933 ðŸ”—

This section discusses the “Fascist UFO Files” published by Roberto Pinotti in 2000. It alleges that a flying saucer crashed near Milan in 1933 and was investigated by a secret Cabinet RS/33, supposedly authorized by Benito Mussolini and led by Guglielmo Marconi. The craft was allegedly stored in hangars of SIAI-Marchetti in Vergiate.

1942 ðŸ”—

A large object with four red lights was reportedly seen in Turin in March.

1950 ðŸ”—

A factory worker near Varese allegedly encountered three humanoids near a craft. One of the entities supposedly shot a beam at the worker, then the humanoids entered the craft and flew away.

1954 ðŸ”—

A UFO sighting occurred in Florence on October 28, 1954, accompanied by a fall of angel hair. Additionally, two UFOs were observed over Taormina, Sicily, with photographs taken by Giuseppe Grasso being published by United Press Newspictures.

1973 ðŸ”—

An Alitalia airplane flying from Rome to Naples sighted a round object, which was confirmed by two Italian Air Force planes from Ciampino. Another sighting occurred at Caselle airport near Turin in the same year.

1978 ðŸ”—

Two hikers on Monte MusinÃ¨ near Torino saw a bright light. One of them temporarily disappeared and was later found in shock with a scald on his leg, claiming to have seen an elongated vehicle and strange beings. Both hikers suffered from conjunctivitis. A close encounter was reported in Torrita di Siena, where a motorist saw a bright object and two small beings in suits and helmets near his car. A boy in a nearby house reported seeing “a kind of small reddish sun” at the same time. The section also mentions the Pier Fortunato Zanfretta incident, an alleged alien abduction in Marzano, Torriglia, near Genoa.

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO_sightings_in_Italy
